questions.question:
Which of the following is the output of the following code?

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base* ptr = new Derived;
    ptr->print();
    delete ptr;
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int x = 5;
    int& ref = x;
    int* ptr = &ref;
    cout << *ptr;
    x = 10;
    cout << *ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class Base {
public:
    Base() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    Derived() {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Derived d;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int arr[] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
    int* ptr = arr;
    ptr += 2;
    cout << *ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

void modify(int& x) {
    x = 10;
}

int main() {
    int y = 5;
    modify(y);
    cout << y;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A a;
    B b;
    A* ptr = &b;
    ptr->func();
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

template 
class MyClass {
public:
    T value;
    MyClass(T val) : value(val) {}
    void print() {
        cout << value << " ";
    }
};

int main() {
    MyClass obj1(5);
    MyClass obj2(3.14);
    obj1.print();
    obj2.print();
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base obj = Derived();
    obj.print();
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

class C : public A, public B {
public:
    C() {
        cout << "C ";
    }
};

int main() {
    C c;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A* ptr = new B;
    B* bptr = dynamic_cast(ptr);
    if (bptr) {
        bptr->func();
    }
    delete ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int* ptr = new int(5);
    cout << *ptr;
    delete ptr;
    cout << *ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class Base {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base* arr[2];
    arr[0] = new Base;
    arr[1] = new Derived;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        arr[i]->print();
    }
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
    A(int x) {
        cout << "A" << x << " ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
    B(int y) {
        cout << "B" << y << " ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B obj(5);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int x = 5;
    int* ptr1 = &x;
    int** ptr2 = &ptr1;
    cout << **ptr2;
    x = 10;
    cout << **ptr2;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B b;
    A& ref = b;
    ref.func();
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B* bptr = new B[2];
    delete[] bptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class Base {
public:
    Base() {
        cout << "Base ";
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    Derived() {
        cout << "Derived ";
    }
};

int main() {
    Base* ptr = new Derived;
    delete ptr;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int arr[5] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
    int* ptr1 = arr;
    int* ptr2 = &arr[2];
    cout << ptr2 - ptr1;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    virtual void print() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void print() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    A* arr[2];
    arr[0] = new A;
    arr[1] = new B;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        arr[i]->print();
    }
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};

class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};

int main() {
    B b;
    A* aptr = &b;
    B* bptr = dynamic_cast(aptr);
    if (bptr) {
        bptr->func();
    }
    return 0;
}
